meanings.definition: Not having the status of being tenured.
meanings.sent1: The new teacher was nontenured and had to work hard to prove herself.
meanings.sent2: She felt uncertain about her nontenured position at the university.
meanings.sent3: The nontenured professor accidentally walked into the wrong classroom on her first day.
meanings.sent4: His nontenured role in the company made him feel like a temporary puzzle piece.
meanings.sent5: The nontenured employee eagerly awaited news of a permanent position.

meanings.sent1: The nontenured staff members were always on edge about their job security.
meanings.sent2: She knew that being nontenured meant she had to work extra hard to secure a permanent position.
meanings.sent3: The nontenured librarian joked that she might have to start a book club for job security.
meanings.sent4: His nontenured status felt like walking on a tightrope without a safety net.
meanings.sent5: The nontenured employee constantly updated his resume, just in case.

meanings.sent1: The nontenured professor was excited about the possibility of earning tenure in the future.
meanings.sent2: She hoped her nontenured position would eventually lead to a permanent role.
meanings.sent3: The nontenured scientist accidentally spilled coffee on her research notes.
meanings.sent4: His nontenured status felt like being a guest at a party instead of a host.
meanings.sent5: The nontenured employee dreamed of the day he would have job security.
